title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: ervissexplore package provides easy access data published EU-ECDC Respiratory Viruses Weekly Data repository. Data returned data.table objects, ready analysis.
code: library(ervissexplore)

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: package supports 7 data sources ERVISS: source dedicated get_*() function, can use generic get_erviss_data(type = ...) function.

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: Positivity rates respiratory pathogens sentinel surveillance. can filter multiple pathogens :
code: data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = c("France", "Germany", "Italy"),   indicator = "positivity" )  head(data) data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = c("SARS-CoV-2", "Influenza", "RSV"),   indicator = "detections" )

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: Variant proportions detection counts.
code: data <- get_erviss_variants(   date_min = as.Date("2025-06-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2025-12-31"),   variant = c("XFG", "LP.8.1"),   countries = c("France", "Belgium"),   indicator = "detections" )  # Filter variants with a minimum proportion data <- get_erviss_variants(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   min_value = 5,   indicator = "proportion" )

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: ILI (Influenza-Like Illness) ARI (Acute Respiratory Infection) consultation rates primary care, stratified age group.
code: # Get ILI consultation rates data <- get_ili_ari_rates(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   indicator = "ILIconsultationrate",   countries = "France" )  # Get both ILI and ARI rates for specific age groups data <- get_ili_ari_rates(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   age = c("0-4", "65+") )

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: SARI (Severe Acute Respiratory Infection) hospitalisation rates, stratified age group.
code: data <- get_sari_rates(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   age = c("0-4", "15-64", "65+"),   countries = c("France", "Belgium") )

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: Tests, detections, positivity rates SARI virological surveillance.
code: # Get positivity for Influenza data <- get_sari_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "Influenza",   indicator = "positivity",   countries = "Belgium" )  # Get detections for all pathogens data <- get_sari_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   indicator = "detections" )

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: Hospital admissions, ICU admissions, ICU inpatients, hospital inpatients, deaths non-sentinel sources.
code: # Get hospital admissions for SARS-CoV-2 data <- get_nonsentinel_severity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   indicator = "hospitaladmissions",   countries = "France" )  # Get multiple severity indicators data <- get_nonsentinel_severity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   indicator = c("hospitaladmissions", "ICUadmissions", "deaths") )

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: Tests detections non-sentinel virological surveillance.
code: data <- get_nonsentinel_tests(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "Influenza",   indicator = "detections",   countries = c("France", "Germany") )

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: Instead remembering specific function name, can use get_erviss_data() type parameter: makes easy switch data sources keeping workflow:
code: # These two calls are equivalent: data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2" )  data <- get_erviss_data(   type = "positivity",   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2" ) types <- c("positivity", "sari_positivity", "nonsentinel_tests")  results <- lapply(types, function(t) {   get_erviss_data(     type = t,     date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),     date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),     pathogen = "Influenza",     countries = "Belgium"   ) })  names(results) <- types

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: functions support fetching historical snapshots reproducible analyses. ERVISS repository stores weekly snapshots data, can retrieve exact data available given date. works data sources: see available snapshot dates, visit EU-ECDC snapshots directory.
code: # Fetch a specific snapshot data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2023-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2023-12-31"),   use_snapshot = TRUE,   snapshot_date = as.Date("2024-02-23") ) data <- get_erviss_data(   type = "nonsentinel_severity",   date_min = as.Date("2023-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2023-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   indicator = "hospitaladmissions",   use_snapshot = TRUE,   snapshot_date = as.Date("2024-02-23") )

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: prefer download data files , can retrieve URLs directly: source also dedicated URL function (e.g., get_sentineltests_positivity_url(), get_ili_ari_rates_url(), etc.).
code: # Latest data URLs get_erviss_url("positivity") #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/sentinelTestsDetectionsPositivity.csv" get_erviss_url("ili_ari_rates") #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/ILIARIRates.csv" get_erviss_url("nonsentinel_severity") #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/nonSentinelSeverity.csv"  # Snapshot URL get_erviss_url(   "variants",   use_snapshot = TRUE,   snapshot_date = as.Date("2023-11-24") ) #> [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EU-ECDC/Respiratory_viruses_weekly_data/refs/heads/main/data/snapshots/2023-11-24_variants.csv"

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: already downloaded data locally, can pass file path directly:
code: data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   csv_file = "path/to/sentinelTestsDetectionsPositivity.csv",   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31") )

title: Fetching ERVISS Data
text: functions return data.table objects. can use data.table syntax convert data.frame / tibble preferred workflow:
code: data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = c("SARS-CoV-2", "Influenza") )  # data.table syntax data[,   .(     mean_positivity = mean(value, na.rm = TRUE),     max_positivity = max(value, na.rm = TRUE),     n_weeks = .N   ),   by = .(countryname, pathogen) ]  # Or convert to tibble for dplyr # tibble::as_tibble(data)

what: Plotting is a bonus, not the core feature
title: Visualization
text: primary goal ervissexplore make easy retrieve filter ERVISS data. plotting functions provided convenience quick exploration, full-featured visualization framework. Since data returned standard data.table, free build visualization want using ggplot2 plotting library.
code: library(ervissexplore) library(ggplot2)

title: Visualization
text: data source dedicated plot_*() function quick_plot_*() shortcut.

title: Visualization
code: data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = c("France", "Germany") )  plot_erviss_positivity(data, date_breaks = "1 month")

title: Visualization
code: data <- get_erviss_variants(   date_min = as.Date("2025-06-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2025-12-31"),   variant = c("XFG"),   countries = c("France", "Belgium") )  plot_erviss_variants(data, date_breaks = "1 month")

title: Visualization
code: data <- get_ili_ari_rates(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   indicator = "ILIconsultationrate",   countries = c("France") )  plot_ili_ari_rates(data, date_breaks = "1 month")

title: Visualization
code: data <- get_sari_rates(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   countries = c("Belgium") )  plot_sari_rates(data, date_breaks = "1 month")

title: Visualization
code: data <- get_sari_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2025-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2025-12-31"),   pathogen = "Influenza",   indicator = "positivity",   countries = c("Belgium") )  plot_sari_positivity(data, date_breaks = "1 month")

title: Visualization
code: data <- get_nonsentinel_severity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   indicator = "hospitaladmissions",   countries = c("EU/EEA"),   age = "total" )  plot_nonsentinel_severity(data, date_breaks = "1 month")

title: Visualization
code: data <- get_nonsentinel_tests(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "Influenza",   indicator = "detections",   countries = c("France", "Germany") )  plot_nonsentinel_tests(data, date_breaks = "1 month")

title: Visualization
text: quick_plot_*() functions combine data fetching plotting single call: can also use generic quick_plot_erviss_data():
code: # One-liner for ILI rates quick_plot_ili_ari_rates(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   indicator = "ILIconsultationrate",   countries = c("France"),   date_breaks = "1 month" ) quick_plot_erviss_data(   type = "nonsentinel_severity",   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   indicator = "hospitaladmissions",   countries = c("France", "Spain"),   date_breaks = "1 month" )

title: Visualization
text: generic function dispatches right plot function based type parameter:
code: data <- get_erviss_data(   type = "sari_rates",   date_min = as.Date("2025-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2025-12-31"),   countries = "Spain" )  plot_erviss_data(data, type = "sari_rates", date_breaks = "1 month") data <- get_erviss_data(   type = "positivity",   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = "EU/EEA",   indicator = "positivity" )  plot_erviss_data(data, type = "positivity")

title: Visualization
text: plot_*() functions return standard ggplot2 objects. can modify freely ggplot2 function.

title: Visualization
code: data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = c("France", "Germany") )  plot_erviss_positivity(data) +   theme_bw() +   theme(     legend.position = "top",     strip.background = element_rect(fill = "steelblue"),     strip.text = element_text(color = "white", face = "bold")   )

title: Visualization
code: plot_erviss_positivity(data) +   scale_x_date(     date_breaks = "1 month",     date_labels = "%d/%m/%Y"   ) +   scale_y_continuous(     limits = c(0, 50),     breaks = seq(0, 50, 10)   ) +   ylab("Positivity (%)")

title: Visualization
code: plot_erviss_positivity(data) +   labs(     title = "My custom title",     subtitle = "SARS-CoV-2 positivity in France and Germany",     caption = "Source: ERVISS / EU-ECDC"   )

title: Visualization
code: data <- get_ili_ari_rates(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   indicator = "ILIconsultationrate",   countries = "France" )  plot_ili_ari_rates(data) +   scale_colour_brewer(palette = "Set1", name = "Age group")

what: Building your own plots from scratch
title: Visualization
text: Since data data.table, can bypass built-plot functions entirely create exactly visualization need:
code: data <- get_nonsentinel_severity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   indicator = c("hospitaladmissions", "ICUadmissions"),   age = "total",   countries = c("France", "Spain") )  ggplot(data, aes(x = date, y = value, fill = indicator)) +   geom_col(position = "dodge") +   facet_wrap(~countryname, scales = "free_y") +   scale_fill_manual(     values = c("hospitaladmissions" = "#E69F00", "ICUadmissions" = "#D55E00"),     labels = c("Hospital admissions", "ICU admissions"),     name = ""   ) +   labs(     title = "SARS-CoV-2 severity indicators",     x = NULL,     y = "Count",     caption = "Source: ERVISS / EU-ECDC"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(legend.position = "top") data <- get_ili_ari_rates(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   indicator = "ILIconsultationrate",   age = "total",   countries = c("Spain", "Austria", "Greece") )  ggplot(data, aes(x = date, y = countryname, fill = value)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_viridis_c(name = "ILI rate") +   scale_x_date(date_breaks = "1 month", date_labels = "%b") +   labs(title = "ILI consultation rates across Europe", x = NULL, y = NULL) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

what: Retrieve and Explore ERVISS Respiratory Virus Surveillance Data
title: Retrieve and Explore ERVISS Respiratory Virus Surveillance Data
text: R package easily retrieve ERVISS (European Respiratory Virus Surveillance Summary) data EU-ECDC. Provides functions fetch, filter, optionally visualize respiratory virus surveillance data across European countries. Please visit https://erviss.org/ detailed description underlying data (see ‘Methods’ footer).

title: Retrieve and Explore ERVISS Respiratory Virus Surveillance Data
code: install.packages("pak") pak::pak("Epiconcept-Paris/ervissexplore")

title: Retrieve and Explore ERVISS Respiratory Virus Surveillance Data
code: library(ervissexplore)  # Retrieve SARS-CoV-2 positivity data positivity_data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = c("France", "Germany", "Italy") )  head(positivity_data) #>                 survtype countryname yearweek   pathogen pathogentype #>                   <char>      <char>   <char>     <char>       <char> #> 1: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W52 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #> 2: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W52 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #> 3: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W52 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #> 4: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W51 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #> 5: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W51 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #> 6: primary care sentinel      France 2024-W51 SARS-CoV-2   SARS-CoV-2 #>    pathogensubtype  indicator    age value       date #>             <char>     <char> <char> <num>     <Date> #> 1:      SARS-CoV-2 detections  total   3.0 2024-12-23 #> 2:      SARS-CoV-2 positivity  total   2.1 2024-12-23 #> 3:      SARS-CoV-2      tests  total 142.0 2024-12-23 #> 4:      SARS-CoV-2 detections  total  13.0 2024-12-16 #> 5:      SARS-CoV-2 positivity  total   4.1 2024-12-16 #> 6:      SARS-CoV-2      tests  total 319.0 2024-12-16

title: Retrieve and Explore ERVISS Respiratory Virus Surveillance Data
text: package fetches data directly EU-ECDC Respiratory Viruses Weekly Data repository. Seven data sources available: generic function get_erviss_data(type = ...) can also used access sources.

title: Retrieve and Explore ERVISS Respiratory Virus Surveillance Data
text: default, functions fetch latest available data. reproducibility, can use historical snapshots: see available snapshot dates, visit EU-ECDC Respiratory Viruses Weekly Data repository.
code: # Use a specific snapshot for reproducible analyses data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2023-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2023-12-31"),   use_snapshot = TRUE,   snapshot_date = as.Date("2024-02-23") )

title: Retrieve and Explore ERVISS Respiratory Virus Surveillance Data
code: # Get positivity data (returns a data.table) data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = c("SARS-CoV-2", "Influenza"),   countries = c("France", "Spain", "Italy"),   indicator = "positivity" )  # Your own analysis with data.table syntax data[,   .(     min_positivity = min(value, na.rm = TRUE),     mean_positivity = mean(value, na.rm = TRUE),     max_positivity = max(value, na.rm = TRUE)   ),   by = .(countryname, pathogen) ] #>    countryname   pathogen min_positivity mean_positivity max_positivity #>         <char>     <char>          <num>           <num>          <num> #> 1:      France  Influenza            0.0       19.223077           58.7 #> 2:      France SARS-CoV-2            0.0        8.942308           66.7 #> 3:       Italy  Influenza            0.6       12.670588           40.5 #> 4:       Italy SARS-CoV-2            0.0        2.247059           10.4 #> 5:       Spain  Influenza            0.2        7.361538           43.7 #> 6:       Spain SARS-CoV-2            0.8       10.626923           45.6

title: Retrieve and Explore ERVISS Respiratory Virus Surveillance Data
code: # ILI consultation rates ili_data <- get_ili_ari_rates(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   indicator = "ILIconsultationrate",   age = c("0-4", "65+"),   countries = "France" )  # Hospital admissions severity_data <- get_nonsentinel_severity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   indicator = "hospitaladmissions",   countries = c("France", "Spain") )  # SARI positivity sari_data <- get_sari_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "Influenza",   indicator = "positivity",   countries = "EU/EEA" )

title: Retrieve and Explore ERVISS Respiratory Virus Surveillance Data
code: # All sources accessible via a single function data <- get_erviss_data(   type = "nonsentinel_severity",   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   indicator = "hospitaladmissions" )

text: package includes optional plotting functions quick exploration. return ggplot2 objects can customized freely:  use quick one-liners:
code: data <- get_sentineltests_positivity(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-06-30"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = c("France", "Spain"),   indicator = "positivity" ) plot_erviss_positivity(data, date_breaks = "1 month") quick_plot_ili_ari_rates(   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   indicator = "ILIconsultationrate",   countries = c("France", "Spain"),   date_breaks = "1 month" )

title: Retrieve and Explore ERVISS Respiratory Virus Surveillance Data
text: New contributors welcome ! can contribute package many ways: reporting bugs, issues feature requests: please open issue GitHub repository. fixing bugs improving package: please clone fork repository, work dedicated branch create pull request.

title: Retrieve and Explore ERVISS Respiratory Virus Surveillance Data
text: European Centre Disease Prevention Control. European Respiratory Virus Surveillance Summary (ERVISS), 2026, Week 05. Available https://erviss.org/.

title: Get ERVISS data — get_erviss_data
text: Retrieves filters data ERVISS (European Respiratory Virus Surveillance Summary). generic function can retrieve available data types.

title: Get ERVISS data — get_erviss_data
code: get_erviss_data(   type = ERVISS_TYPES,   csv_file = NULL,   date_min,   date_max,   pathogen = "",   variant = "",   indicator = "",   age = "",   countries = "",   min_value = 0,   use_snapshot = FALSE,   snapshot_date = NULL )

title: Get ERVISS data — get_erviss_data
text: type Type data. One : "positivity", "variants", "ili_ari_rates", "sari_rates", "sari_positivity", "nonsentinel_severity", "nonsentinel_tests". csv_file Path local CSV file URL containing ERVISS data. NULL (default), data fetched official ERVISS repository. date_min Start date period (Date object) date_max End date period (Date object) pathogen Character vector pathogen names filter. Used types: "positivity", "sari_positivity", "nonsentinel_severity", "nonsentinel_tests". Use "" (default) include pathogens. variant Character vector variant names filter. used type = "variants". Use "" (default) include variants. indicator Character vector indicators filter. available values depend data type. Use "" (default) include indicators. age Character vector age groups filter. Used types: "ili_ari_rates", "sari_rates", "sari_positivity", "nonsentinel_severity", "nonsentinel_tests". Use "" (default) include age groups. countries Character vector country names filter. Use "" (default) include countries. min_value Minimum value threshold (default: 0). used type = "variants". use_snapshot Logical. TRUE, fetches historical snapshot; FALSE (default), fetches latest data. Ignored csv_file provided. snapshot_date Date snapshot retrieve. Required use_snapshot = TRUE csv_file NULL.

title: Get ERVISS data — get_erviss_data
text: data.table containing filtered data.

title: Get ERVISS data — get_erviss_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get positivity data data <- get_erviss_data(   type = "positivity",   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   countries = "France" )  # Get ILI consultation rates data <- get_erviss_data(   type = "ili_ari_rates",   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   indicator = "ILIconsultationrate",   age = "total" )  # Get non-sentinel severity data data <- get_erviss_data(   type = "nonsentinel_severity",   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2",   indicator = "hospitaladmissions" ) } # }

title: Get ERVISS data URL — get_erviss_url
text: Builds URL download ERVISS data, either latest batch specific snapshot.

title: Get ERVISS data URL — get_erviss_url
code: get_erviss_url(type = ERVISS_TYPES, use_snapshot = FALSE, snapshot_date = NULL)

title: Get ERVISS data URL — get_erviss_url
text: type Type data. One : "positivity", "variants", "ili_ari_rates", "sari_rates", "sari_positivity", "nonsentinel_severity", "nonsentinel_tests". use_snapshot Logical. TRUE, returns snapshot URL; FALSE (default), returns URL latest data. snapshot_date Date snapshot retrieve (required use_snapshot = TRUE). Must Date object.

title: Get ERVISS data URL — get_erviss_url

what: Quick plot of ERVISS data — quick_plot_erviss_data
title: Quick plot of ERVISS data — quick_plot_erviss_data
text: Convenience function fetches plots ERVISS data one step. generic function can handle available data types. control, use get_erviss_data followed plot_erviss_data.

title: Quick plot of ERVISS data — quick_plot_erviss_data
code: quick_plot_erviss_data(   type = ERVISS_TYPES,   csv_file = NULL,   date_min,   date_max,   pathogen = "",   variant = "",   indicator = "",   age = "",   countries = "",   min_value = 0,   date_breaks = NULL,   date_format = "%b %Y",   use_snapshot = FALSE,   snapshot_date = NULL )

title: Quick plot of ERVISS data — quick_plot_erviss_data
text: type Type data. One : "positivity", "variants", "ili_ari_rates", "sari_rates", "sari_positivity", "nonsentinel_severity", "nonsentinel_tests". csv_file Path local CSV file URL containing ERVISS data. NULL (default), data fetched official ERVISS repository. date_min Start date period (Date object) date_max End date period (Date object) pathogen Character vector pathogen names filter. Used types: "positivity", "sari_positivity", "nonsentinel_severity", "nonsentinel_tests". Use "" (default) include pathogens. variant Character vector variant names filter. used type = "variants". Use "" (default) include variants. indicator Character vector indicators filter. available values depend data type. Use "" (default) include indicators. age Character vector age groups filter. Used types: "ili_ari_rates", "sari_rates", "sari_positivity", "nonsentinel_severity", "nonsentinel_tests". Use "" (default) include age groups. countries Character vector country names filter. Use "" (default) include countries. min_value Minimum value threshold (default: 0). used type = "variants". date_breaks string specifying date breaks x-axis (e.g., "1 month", "2 weeks"). NULL, sensible default chosen based data type. date_format string specifying date format x-axis labels (e.g., "%b %Y" "Jan 2024") use_snapshot Logical. TRUE, fetches historical snapshot; FALSE (default), fetches latest data. Ignored csv_file provided. snapshot_date Date snapshot retrieve. Required use_snapshot = TRUE csv_file NULL.

title: Quick plot of ERVISS data — quick_plot_erviss_data
text: ggplot2 object showing data time country

title: Quick plot of ERVISS data — quick_plot_erviss_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Quick visualization of positivity data quick_plot_erviss_data(   type = "positivity",   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   pathogen = "SARS-CoV-2" )  # Quick visualization of ILI rates quick_plot_erviss_data(   type = "ili_ari_rates",   date_min = as.Date("2024-01-01"),   date_max = as.Date("2024-12-31"),   indicator = "ILIconsultationrate" ) } # }
